headline: Kyndryl’s Collapse Isn’t a Dip Worth Buying
summary: Shares of the IT infrastructure firm plunged more than 50% after executive exits, an accounting review, and a downgrade from Guggenheim. Analysts warn investors to stay on the sidelines.

headline: IBM Introduces Autonomous Storage with New FlashSystem Portfolio Powered by Agentic AI
summary: IBM (NYSE: IBM) today unveiled the next generation of IBM FlashSystem, co-run by agentic AI, ushering in a new era of autonomous storage. By enhancing FlashSystem's existing AI capabilities with agentic AI, IBM is redefining resilience through sustained protection, autonomous threat analysis, and customized recovery recommendations. headline: IBM’s Defense And AI Cybersecurity Moves Versus Current Valuation Picture
summary: IBM (NYSE:IBM) has been selected to support the U.S. Missile Defense Agency's SHIELD program, expanding its role in national defense technology. The company is also integrating external AI-powered threat intelligence into its QRadar SIEM and SOAR cybersecurity platforms. These developments highlight IBM's focus on advanced defense and security solutions that rely on AI and data-informed decision making. For investors watching NYSE:IBM, these updates sit squarely in two of the company’s core...

headline: NTT DATA Appoints Seelan Nayagam as Asia Pacific CEO
summary: LONDON, February 10, 2026--NTT DATA, a global leader in AI, digital business and technology services, today announced the appointment of Seelan Nayagam as the new Chief Executive Officer for Asia Pacific at NTT DATA, Inc., effective March 16, 2026, based in Singapore. Nayagam succeeds John Lombard and will report directly to NTT DATA, Inc. President and CEO, Abhijit Dubey.

raw.headline: NTT DATA Appoints Seelan Nayagam as Asia Pacific CEO
raw.summary: LONDON, February 10, 2026--NTT DATA, a global leader in AI, digital business and technology services, today announced the appointment of Seelan Nayagam as the new Chief Executive Officer for Asia Pacific at NTT DATA, Inc., effective March 16, 2026, based in Singapore. Nayagam succeeds John Lombard and will report directly to NTT DATA, Inc. President and CEO, Abhijit Dubey.

headline: KD Q4 Deep Dive: Delayed Sales and IBM Partnership Shift Weigh on Performance
summary: IT infrastructure services provider Kyndryl (NYSE:KD) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 as sales rose 3.1% year on year to $3.86 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.52 per share was 13.7% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: KD Q4 Deep Dive: Delayed Sales and IBM Partnership Shift Weigh on Performance
